publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3473.1 James Kelly: A Questionable Future for Nuclear Safety—As an amendment to motion (S3M-3473) in the name of Rob Gibson, leave out from "condemns" to end and insert "notes that the board of the Health and Safety Executive (HSE) decided not to reappoint its former Nuclear Safety Advisory Committee after it had completed its term of office last year because of the need to respond to the Stone Report on nuclear regulation; further notes the recommendations of the Stone Report, published in January 2009, and its implications for the HSE, and looks forward to the HSE taking the necessary steps to ensure that the very strong safety record of nuclear power stations in Scotland is further strengthened by the development of new mechanisms appropriate to the changing circumstances of the nuclear energy industry in the twenty-first century." Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-3473.1 A Questionable Future for Nuclear Safety (lodged on 25 February 2009) Mary Mulligan*, Elaine Murray*, Cathie Craigie*, Jackie Baillie*, Hugh Henry*, Andy Kerr*

S3M-3473.1 James Kelly: A Questionable Future for Nuclear Safety—As an amendment to motion (S3M-3473) in the name of Rob Gibson, leave out from "condemns" to end and insert "notes that the board of the Health and Safety Executive (HSE) decided not to reappoint its former Nuclear Safety Advisory Committee after it had completed its term of office last year because of the need to respond to the Stone Report on nuclear regulation; further notes the recommendations of the Stone Report, published in January 2009, and its implications for the HSE, and looks forward to the HSE taking the necessary steps to ensure that the very strong safety record of nuclear power stations in Scotland is further strengthened by the development of new mechanisms appropriate to the changing circumstances of the nuclear energy industry in the twenty-first century." Supported by: Mary Mulligan, Elaine Murray, Cathie Craigie, Jackie Baillie, Hugh Henry, Andy Kerr
